column5: So today i again walked the shores of Lake Scugog. I started off this morning using a  buzz baits then some tubes and then a spinner bait. I had no success with any of these techineques. I then used a Strike King bass jig tipped with a Yum Chunk and started flipping the jig very close to any cover i could find. After about 10 minuted i brought my jig in quickly and a nice size bass slammed it. This would count to be my FIRST largemouth bass on a bass jig  . I guess you could say i was "swimming" the jig. The bass weighed 2.8lbs.
Your a brave man fishing scugog from shore... lots of weeds. But i guess it paid off for ya! nice bass!

O ya thats for sure. I didn't get to fish it as much as i would of liked this year, i was there just after bass season opened and maybe once during the summer. I should be there a few more times before the season is done. Wish me luck!
Can't beat a jig for bass. I assume you ate that largie, how did it taste from the bog?
